technique: Exploration
Kocher maneuver
Blunt dissection to push posterior wall of pancreas from underlying inferior vena cava
Free the second and third part of the Duodenum
Incision through the lesser sac
Peritoneum over the superior border of duodenum is incised
Isolate common bile duct
Ligate right gastroepiploic vessels
Encircle the antrum
Ligate right gastric vessels
Antrectomy
Identify common hepatic artery and gastroduodenal artery
Ligate gastroduodenal artery
Pass a blunt clamp or finger between portal vein and neck of pancreas
Divide the neck of the pancreas
Ligate small veins from portal vein to head of pancreas
Incise peritoneum about the third portion of duodenum
Ligate short mesentery of duodenum
Cholecystectomy
Incise mesentery below arcades to movilize jejunum
Divide bowel where blood supply is good
Remove specimen
Bring jejunum through opening in mesocolon
The pancreas is anastomosed to the open end of the jejunum
Choledocojejunostomy with a single-layer termino-lateral anastomosis
Anchor jejunum to the liver bed
Gastrojejunal anastamosis
Closed-suction drains placed next to anastomosis
